title: MCP Tools Schema
description: JSON Schema for MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools array based on the MCP specification

name.description: Intended for programmatic or logical use, but used as a display name in past specs or fallback

title.description: Tool-level title: Intended for UI and end-user contexts â€” optimized to be human-readable and easily understood, even by those unfamiliar with domain-specific terminology. If not provided, the name should be used for display.

description.description: A human-readable description of the tool

inputSchema.description: A JSON Schema object defining the expected parameters for the tool

outputSchema.description: An optional JSON Schema object defining the structure of the tool's output

annotations.description: Optional annotations providing hints about the tool's behavior

handler.description: Optional file path to a handler module that exports a function to handle tool calls. The path can be resolved by require() at runtime. The handler function signature is: async function handler(args: Record<string, unknown>): Promise<unknown>

type.description: Must be 'object' for MCP tool input schemas

properties.description: Object properties defining the tool parameters

type.description: Must be 'object' for MCP tool output schemas

properties.description: Object properties defining the output structure

title.description: Annotation title hint: A human-readable title for the tool (this is a hint in annotations, distinct from the tool-level title field)

readOnlyHint.description: If true, the tool does not modify its environment

destructiveHint.description: If true, the tool may perform destructive updates to its environment

idempotentHint.description: If true, calling the tool repeatedly with the same arguments will have no additional effect

openWorldHint.description: If true, this tool may interact with an 'open world' of external systems
